programmes.show_description: 2/5. Wildlife documentary telling the story of Moja, a five-month-old lion cub living with his single lioness mum, Nyota, in Kenya's Masai Mara. Together, they face a fight for life.
4/12. The candidates must create a TV ad and a social media campaign for bottled water.
4/11. Angela Scanlon and guests take a deep dive into the candidates' performances.
3/4. Simon tries to warn his friends as the latest beast sighting spreads terror across the camps. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
1/29. Four chefs compete for north west England with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by the British film industry. Who will be eliminated?
Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.
An estranged brother and sister come face to face for the first time in nearly five years. Will two days in the wild be enough to heal the rift between them?
It's an emotional reunion for the new owner of a Staffordshire house.
11/15. The British people are proud of their beef dishes, and the French are too. Steak frites is a national institution, but in Provence, Marcus is expecting something a little different.
12/15. Herbes de Provence is famous. But with no UK equivalent, Marcus wants to create his own simple dried herb mix to rival this French classic and turn any dull dish into a tasty meal.
Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.
The big political issues of the day.
Catrin Heledd introduces live coverage of the last-16 matches at Venue Cymru, where quarter-final places are up for grabs.
14/25. Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where contestants compete for the cash prize. Who will rise to the top and see off their challengers?
25/60. A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series, with brand new valuations and unexpected auctions.

programmes.show_name: New: Richard Osman's House of Games
programmes.show_description: 79/100. Michelle Ackerley, Katie Derham, Karen Hauer and Geoff Norcott face more trivia questions.
4/20. Vernon Kay, with Paul Gorton in tow, challenges Anneka Rice, comedian Shane Todd and DJ Remi Burgz to separate the real from the ridiculous. This time, the destination is Jedburgh.
Abigail Davies introduces live coverage of the last-16 matches at the Welsh Open.
3/29. It's judging day, and only one chef can go through to represent north west England. Casting director Debbie McWilliams helps decide the winner from the two remaining chefs.
Lauren Salter and guests discuss the latest in Welsh rugby.

5/11. Angela Scanlon and guests take a deep dive into the candidates' performances.
Insights and global interviews on the news stories of the day. With Paddy O'Connell.   Followed by Weather.

programmes.show_name: Planet Earth: A Tale of Three Bears
programmes.show_description: 1/5. Julia Bradbury presents the live wildlife programme following the progress of three black bear cubs as they follow their mother through the spectacular Northwoods of Minnesota.
A has-been actor re-enacts his most famous role as a TV detective for a police sting. Contains strong language and adult humour. [2016]
6/11. Gladiators ready! Bradley and Barney Walsh welcome four ferocious Contenders back to the arena to face the Gladiators, and the Eliminator, in the first of the quarter-finals.
8/8. Amanda and Alan go all out with the last space, designing a gorgeous outdoor kitchen.
2/29. The remaining three chefs from north west England compete over mains and desserts inspired by the British film industry. Who will win, and who must go home?
Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.
Former schoolfriends Ian and Dan have drifted apart - and don't know how to talk about their feelings and the struggles of adult life. Can Bear help?
A firefighter is on hand to try to save a Somerset terrace.
5/10. Clive learns about his family story on an emotional visit to a former slave fort, before getting a big celebratory welcome - and a new name - from the elders of the Fante people.
6/10. Clive experiences the beauty of Nigerian art in one of the continent's largest cities.

15/25. Susan Calman hosts the quiz show of tactics, knowledge and nerve. Contestants must work as a team, but ultimately there can only be one Boss.
4/40. Christina Trevanion and Raj Bisram are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Christina values a pair of Wedgwood plates, while a gold guinea impresses Raj.

programmes.show_name: New: Richard Osman's House of Games
programmes.show_description: 80/100. The celebrities face their final quizzes, and the week's winner is crowned.

3/4. Monty looks back at some of the remarkable gardeners shining a light on how people can grow their own nutritious food fresh from the garden.
